page.title: 01Description of Adisham Area
page.content: Adisham village lies in a hollow of the chalk Kentish Downs about 125 feet above sea level, approximately six miles from Canterbury, nine from Sand- wich. To reach it means passing along roads that wind through undulating open landscape of corn fields stretching to far distant woodlands. Trees line the railway line cutting almost diagonally through the area. Wind sweeps across the high ground rising to 250 feet, a golden vista in autumn. Cows and sheep graze near the village. The Church stands high overlooking the green beyond which lies the long straggling street of mainly modern houses. A council estate is opposite the green. Bloodden runs parallel to the village street con- taining a cluster of houses with the farm of Little Cooting at the far end. Bossington hamlet lies 1/2 mile east.
